keywords.value: House Oversight and Government Reform Committee
keywords.name: organizations

byline.original: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

lead_paragraph: Republican lawmakers on Thursday used blunt testimony from the director, James B. Comey, to try to build a case that Hillary Clinton repeatedly lied to the public.

headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Head Rebuts Republican Criticism Over Email Inquiry
headline.main: F.B.I. Director Testifies on Clinton Emails to Withering Criticism From G.O.P.

snippet: Republican lawmakers on Thursday used blunt testimony from the director, James B. Comey, to try to build a case that Hillary Clinton repeatedly lied to the public....
abstract: James B Comey Jr, director of FBI, defends himself against Republican condemnation for ending investigation into Hillary Clinton's email practices during her tenure as secretary of state, while at same time offering details that may further damage Clinton ahead of her confirmation as Democratic presidential nominee; admits Clinton made statements that have been contradicted by investigation and that her actions were sufficient grounds for sanctions.
